articles.title: 3,000-Year-Old Murder Mystery Solved: Shark Attack
articles.description: A large shark, possibly a great white or a tiger, fatally attacked a young man. The man’s wounds were extensive, including the loss of a leg, a hand, and both feet. Thanks to those at the time who recovered his body and the way in which they buried him, his b…

articles.author: Isaac Schultz
articles.title: Extremely Sexy Pointy Shoes Warped the Feet of Medieval Europeans
articles.description: A 15th-century shoe craze that swept Europe left its mark on the skeletons of people who lived at the time. Archaeologists have recently attributed a plague of bunions found on nearly 200 skeletons to a popular shoe style with a long pointed toe.Read more...

articles.title: Did Humans Stab This Ice Age Cave Bear Through the Skull?
